page.title: 03RATHO VILLAGE
page.content: THE VILLAGE HAS QUITE A FEW SHOPS WHICH SELL MAINLY FOODSTUFFS ALTHOUGH IT WAS FOUND THAT MOST PEOPLE WENT TO THE LARGER SUPERMARKETS IN TOWN FOR THEIR WEEKLY SHOPPING. THERE IS A MOBILE LIBRARY WHICH COMES TO THE VILLAGE TWICE A WEEK AND SEEMS TO BE WELL USED. THERE IS A COMMUNITY CENTRE ATTACHED TO THE SCHOOL WHICH PROVIDES A MEETING PLACE AS WELL AS FACILITIES FOR BADMINTON,SNOOKER,KEEP FIT AND MANY OTHER CLUB ACTIVITIES BESIDES. IT WAS FOUND THAT THE CENTRE WAS MAINLY USED BY THE YOUNGER PEOPLE FOR ENTERTAINMENT WHILE THE ADULTS TENDED TO GO TO EDINBURGH FOR THEIRS. WHEN INTERVIEWED THE MAJORITY OF THE PEOPLE SAID THAT THE REASON THEY STAYED IN THE VILLAGE WAS FOR THE RURAL SURROUNDINGS COUPLED WITH ITS PROXIMITY TO EDINBURGH.
